A cloud of dangerous pathogens erupts in a 30-foot cone originating from you and clings to the creatures inside of it. Choose one of the following @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Diseases}:

  • Kobold Flu: An infected creature has a -2 penalty to attack rolls and skill checks.
  • Lovers’ Pox: An infected creature suffers 2d4 poison damage when it starts its turn within 5 feet of any other creatures.
  • Mana Fever: An infected creature must spend 1 extra mana to cast spells and charged versions of cantrips.
Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution (Save) check. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d4 poison damage and becomes temporarily infected with the chosen @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Disease}. On a successful save, it takes half damage and is not infected. An infected creature can repeat the save check at the end of each of its turns, ending the disease on a success.
    If the creature fails its Constitution (Save) check 5 times, they stop making the save, and the @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Disease} remains indefinitely.
